clinical_study.brief_title: Augmenting Patching Treatment for Amblyopia With Physical Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Augmenting Patching Treatment for Amblyopia With Physical Exercise

brief_summary.textblock: Researches are trying to establish whether moderate exercise enhances the treatment benefit of patching 2 hours a day for residual amblyopia in children.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month (3 weeks to 8 weeks) after initiating game play
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure will be LogMAR visual acuity measured 1 month (primary analysis window 3 weeks to 8 weeks) after initiating game play.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Physical Exercise in addition to Patching
arm_group.description: Patch for 2 hours a day, and exercise (using the videogame JustDance) for the first 30 minutes of those 2 hours using the video game (continuing to wear the patch for 90 minutes after exercise).

intervention.intervention_name: Physical Exercise in addition to Patching
intervention.description: Patch for 2 hours a day, and exercise for the first 30 minutes of those 2 hours using the video game
intervention.arm_group_label: Physical Exercise in addition to Patching

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 5 to < 17 years old
- Cycloplegic refraction within past year
- Diagnosis of residual amblyopia, with no evidence of regression of amblyopic eye visual acuity by 1 or more LogMAR from best previous
- Completed at least 6 months prior patching treatment (minimum 2 hours/day) or atropine treatment.
- Stable visual acuity as defined by <1 LogMAR change over 2 visits
- Xbox 360 Kinect, Wii or WiiU gaming system in the home, or a different gaming system with a version of Just Dance® already in the home.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known problems with exercise tolerance
- No gaming system in the home that supports Just Dance® Kids 2014, and no existing version of Just Dance® in the home
- Current atropine treatment for amblyopia
